alert.note: Alert for Lee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 29 at 6:06PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Florida, including the following county, Lee. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 606 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cape Coral, Fort Myers, Villas, Pine Manor, East Dunbar, Southwest Florida Airport, Cypress Lake, McGregor, San Carlos Park, Three Oaks, Lochmoor Waterway Estates, Harlem Heights, Buckingham, Palmona Park, Iona, Matlacha Isles-Matlacha Shores, Page Park, Page Field Airport, Fort Myers Villas and Whiskey Creek. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
